reviews.text: The Embassy Greensboro was pretty decent. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. It is time for a renovation, but the room definitely served the purpose. There are not many hotels that offer the evening reception and complimentary hot breakfast so it worked for me.
reviews.title: Great for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went last minute to the hotel.. we had excellent food, swam in the pool and from like 6-8 we had free drinks in the lounge!! That made it all worth while!!! We did have to change rooms bc we had a smoking room and it smelled so bad we went to non-smoking.
reviews.title: For Our Anniversary

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews here, I was apprehensive about booking for my family for a one nite stay on the way home from the Outer Banks, NC. I have stayed at an Embassy Suites extensively in Kansas City for business and found the hotels are usually quite nice. This recently remodeled hotel in Greensboro was no exception...it was clean, quiet, conveniently located and as always - the breakfast was great! The room was clean (king/non-smoking), the towels were clean, the bathroom was clean, everything worked. It is located in a nice area, close to the airport, right off of the highway. NO problems here and the price was right. $99/nite.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: This hotel is located close to the Greensboro airport and I-40 highway. It is an older property that needs renovation and better attention to details. I had a one-night stay in a corner room on the top floor and found the following pros and cons.
reviews.title: Needs renovation and more attention to details

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Great Service, but worn out hotel!!

likes.disliked: — Everything else, was surprised this property still carries an Embassy brand.

reviews.text: We decided to drive up and stay here last minute to attend a local graduation. We called and were able to get a room... it was the last room with 2 beds, we were told. Bedding was nice - very comfy, room was clean, breakfast was just ok... (it was included). Only damper on the stay was a spot in the floor that was damp and remained damp. I would say this is an average stay hotel.
reviews.title: Ok Stay

reviews.text: Hotel has the standard Embassy features - manager's reception and breakfast. The property has quick access to GSO, about 10 minutes. The hotel was clearly renovated recently, and the rooms are very well done - I had a corner room (suite?), which was huge. Minor gripe, that the HD TVs had no HD channels. (Embassy's like to give you 2 TVs - 1 per room - but has you pay a small fee for internet if you're not HH Gold/Diamond). Also, the hotel gets a B grade (passable) for noise insulation between rooms; it seems that newer hotels do a better job at this. However, in general, this is definitely my hotel of choice the night before flights out of GSO, but I would also recommend for business in the immediate area.
reviews.title: Great hotel for GSO traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was very pleased with this hotel. Staff was friendly, room was great and beds were comfortable. Didn't hear any noise from the nearby airport. Complimentary breakfast and evening reception were nice as well.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The location, service and amenities are great. The staff are helpful and respectful.
reviews.title: Comforts of Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The space is clean and supplied well.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and a Good Value

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a soccer tournament, and found it very comfortable and clean. The complimentary breakfast was amazing (we're talking made-to-order omelets, scrambled eggs, pancakes, biscuits, everything you could think of). Was enough to get my teenager out of bed and moving! The managers reception each evening with free drinks and munchies was the right way to kick off the night.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience - only one drawback.

reviews.text: As for comfort, when I travel I always bring a sleep aid, but the beds were so comfortable I never even used them, and made sure to set the alarm. Having two flat screen TV's in each room also made traveling with children more enjoyable.
reviews.title: What a nightmare, Police, swat team, need I say more?

reviews.text: At 10:30, the management was quick to clear out the main hotel areas of any noisy people still lingering around so the noise didn't migrate to the rooms, sending them outside to the pool deck to continue socializing.
reviews.title: Excellent Venue for Conference

reviews.text: Of course, the fact that we had a bedroom and could shut the living room off for my teenage son was wonderful.
reviews.title: Very Average, Air Conditioning is Awful

reviews.text: As for the one drawback? No free internet (wireless or otherwise), except in their business center. Still charging 9.95 per day for in-room wireless, which is ridiculous.
reviews.title: It's a Good Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel feels like home away from home. The staff are so nice, and with awesome southern charm and manners. SO NICE to have a REAL breakfast and eggs cooked to order! LOVE the managers happy hour!!!
reviews.title: Love this property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though the hotel was crowded when we arrived, the employees on duty were very efficient, and we were able to check in without waiting. Our two room suite was clean, spacious and nicely decorated. There was an extra sink and vanity in the bedroom which was very convenient. The bedroom and living room both had flat screen TVs. However, as seems to be the case in all other Embassy Suites that we’ve stayed at, there wasn’t much choice in TV channels. The business center, located off the lobby, had two computers and printers. The fitness center had treadmills, an exercise bike, and free weights. There was also an indoor pool, which we didn’t use. Breakfast was complimentary and consisted of hot and cold items. Hot dishes, like eggs and pancakes, were cooked to order, and the rest was self serve. Since the hotel is near a highway, we did hear the sound of traffic passing by. It’s also located close to the airport, but we didn’t hear any noise from there.
reviews.title: Large Room, Good Breakfast, Fast Service

reviews.text: This Embassy was just what we needed after a long drive. We usually stay at Hamptons while traveling, but on our way to the beach with two tired kids we decided to pull off the highway and give the Embassy a try. Boy, are we glad we did. First of all, the front desk staff was very accomodating and gave us a great rate considering our late arrival. The interior was very nice and my three year old loved all the fountains. Our room was well appointed and for once I did not have to call down for extra towels or pillows. The bathroom was also clean and had a good caulk job around the tub, free of mildew ( bad caulk and mildew is a huge pet peeve of mine in hotels. How hard is it to do the job right?)
reviews.title: What a relief! The perfect stop after a long drive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dreaded loading the kids back up to go out for dinner so we were relieved to find out they had room service. Not only that, it was prompt, delicious, and affordable as far as room service goes. We left too early to sample their free breakfast, but would have liked to if we'd had more time.
reviews.title: Excellent property

reviews.text: This hotel is near the airport and highway, but we never noticed the noise as it is very well sound proofed. I almost wished we could have stayed longer and if we ever pass through Greensboro again, I plan on making this the hotel where we stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!! Immaculately Clean & Fantastic Breakfast!
